hackathon-description-text: hackMCST III is the first annual 24-hour hackathon at Morris County School of Technology in Denville, New Jersey. hackMCST is created by high school students for high school students to create, learn, and grow. With workshops, mini-events, tech talks, and a great environment, we are empowering the future generation of innovators and problem-solvers!
hackathon-requirements: Each team must submit one submission by 8am on Sunday. If a team does not submit their hack by 8am, they will not qualify for judging or prizes. Teams must only submit a hack that was create during the hacking period. Any project made previously to the event or created before the hacking period will be disqualified.
hackathon-rules:
We are dedicated to creating a safe and all-inclusive event. All hackers must abide by the

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the hackMCST staff may take any action they deem appropriate. Please contact hackMCST staff or email us at 
 if you are being harassed or notice someone else being harassed. 
We expect participants to follow these rules at hackathon and all hackBCA related events.
If a participant leaves the event at any time, they will not be readmitted into the event and forfeit the hackathon and the ability to win prizes. Participants may not leave the MCST campus unless signed out by a parent. Participants should not enter restricted areas of MCST campus.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the team will receive a $75 Amazon Gift Card.
Each member of the team will receive a $50 Amazon Gift Card.
Each member of the team will receive a $25 Amazon Gift Card.
The entire team will win one $250 Amazon Gift Card provided by .tech Domains.
The entire team will win 2 Raspberry Pi's and Moleskine Notebooks.
Each member of the team will receive a Raspberry Pi & PiHut Essential Kit.
Each member of the team will receive a Qualcomm DragonBoard 410c + power source.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device
